title: After crash that killed 6 teens, NTSB chief says people underestimate marijuana's impact on drivers
content: NTSB Chair Jennifer Homendy warns parents about marijuana-impaired driving risks following a fatal Tishomingo crash killing six teens. The NTSB highlights THC impairment and distractions. They recommend including a drug and alcohol abuse curriculum, as seen in Massachusetts and Rhode Island. With recreational marijuana legalization, enforcement is lagging. Patrol findings showed high THC levels.
summary: NTSB Chair Jennifer Homendy warns parents about marijuana-impaired driving risks following a fatal Tishomingo crash killing six teens. The NTSB highlights THC impairment and distractions. They recommend including a drug and alcohol abuse curriculum, as seen in Massachusetts and Rhode Island. With recreational marijuana legalization, enforcement is lagging. Patrol findings showed high THC levels.

title: 'I named a, uh, the ...': Biden stumbles over Lloyd Austin's name, calls him 'black man'
First woman to lead Canada's armed forces takes command
content: Jennie Carignan, with extensive military experience, becomes Canada's first female defense chief, facing Ukraine, climate change, tensions, and democracy threats. Canada targets 2% GDP defense-spending by 2032, with 1.39% projected for 2024-25. Led by Justin Trudeau, the military struggles with modernization and recruitment. The navy is in a critical state.
summary: Jennie Carignan, with extensive military experience, becomes Canada's first female defense chief, facing Ukraine, climate change, tensions, and democracy threats. Canada targets 2% GDP defense-spending by 2032, with 1.39% projected for 2024-25. Led by Justin Trudeau, the military struggles with modernization and recruitment. The navy is in a critical state.

title: Woman's 'sex acts' on statue of Bacchus in Italy sparks outrage

Bangladeshi state TV headquarters put on fire, 'many' trapped inside
content: Protestors in Bangladesh set the state TV headquarters on fire amid demonstrations against the Sheikh Hasina government's decision on job quotas. The incident occurred on Thursday, causing fears that many may be trapped inside the building. An official from the station reported that hundreds of protesters stormed the premises and set ablaze at least 60 vehicles and an office building. "They first torched a police post at Rampura after police opened fire at them," he said, referring to a neighborhood in the capital, Dhaka.
summary: Protestors in Bangladesh set the state TV headquarters on fire amid demonstrations against the Sheikh Hasina government's decision on job quotas. The incident occurred on Thursday, causing fears that many may be trapped inside the building. An official from the station reported that hundreds of protesters stormed the premises and set ablaze at least 60 vehicles and an office building. "They first torched a police post at Rampura after police opened fire at them," he said, referring to a neighborhood in the capital, Dhaka.

title: Ursula von der Leyen re-elected as European Commission president
EU chief Ursula von der Leyen gets another 5-year term
content: European Union (EU) chief Ursula von der Leyen secured another five-year term as president of the European Commission after winning support from EU lawmakers on Thursday. The 720-member European Parliament approved her with 401 votes in favour, 284 against, and 15 abstentions. Von der Leyen needed 361 votes to pass. Her selection comes at the same time as the arrival of recently elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Keir Starmer.
summary: European Union (EU) chief Ursula von der Leyen secured another five-year term as president of the European Commission after winning support from EU lawmakers on Thursday. The 720-member European Parliament approved her with 401 votes in favour, 284 against, and 15 abstentions. Von der Leyen needed 361 votes to pass. Her selection comes at the same time as the arrival of recently elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Keir Starmer.

title: EU chief puts defence, industry at heart of re-election pitch
content: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday made her final pitch to win EU lawmakers' backing for a second term, vowing to bolster Europe's defence and strengthening its industry through greater investment. She vowed to boost Europe's competitiveness and ensure significant investment in key industries including defence.
summary: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday made her final pitch to win EU lawmakers' backing for a second term, vowing to bolster Europe's defence and strengthening its industry through greater investment. She vowed to boost Europe's competitiveness and ensure significant investment in key industries including defence.

title: Internet shut, nationwide bandh announced: Why is Bangladesh experiencing deadly protests
India put to 'unjustified pressure' due to energy ties with Russia: Russian FM
content: Sergey Lavrov criticized the pressure on India over energy ties with Russia, addressing Zelenskyy's remarks about Modi's visit and a hospital strike. He also condemned the Ukrainian ambassador, praised India’s autonomy, and Jaishankar's strategy to secure food and fertilizer by purchasing oil from multiple sources despite Western displeasure towards China and India.
summary: Sergey Lavrov criticized the pressure on India over energy ties with Russia, addressing Zelenskyy's remarks about Modi's visit and a hospital strike. He also condemned the Ukrainian ambassador, praised India’s autonomy, and Jaishankar's strategy to secure food and fertilizer by purchasing oil from multiple sources despite Western displeasure towards China and India.

Bangladesh quota protesters announce nationwide shutdown today, PM Hasina 'regrets' casualties
content: Student protesters advocating for reforms in the government job quota system have declared a nationwide shutdown for Thursday, following incidents involving security forces that resulted in the deaths of six people, including four students, nationwide. Asif Mahmud, a leading coordinator of the movement, announced on Facebook that all establishments, except hospitals and emergency services, will shut down, with only ambulance services allowed to operate.
summary: Student protesters advocating for reforms in the government job quota system have declared a nationwide shutdown for Thursday, following incidents involving security forces that resulted in the deaths of six people, including four students, nationwide. Asif Mahmud, a leading coordinator of the movement, announced on Facebook that all establishments, except hospitals and emergency services, will shut down, with only ambulance services allowed to operate.

title: US union organizing, and unions' election win rate, is surging, NLRB says
content: Recent data from the National Labor Relations Board reveals a surge in union election petitions, with over 2,600 filed this fiscal year, exceeding the previous year's total. Unions have seen a 32% increase in petitions, winning 79% of elections they pursued, up from 76% last year. Despite these gains, union representation among US workers remains historically low. Experts attribute the rise in organizing efforts to pandemic concerns and regulatory shifts favoring unions under the Biden administration.
summary: Recent data from the National Labor Relations Board reveals a surge in union election petitions, with over 2,600 filed this fiscal year, exceeding the previous year's total. Unions have seen a 32% increase in petitions, winning 79% of elections they pursued, up from 76% last year. Despite these gains, union representation among US workers remains historically low. Experts attribute the rise in organizing efforts to pandemic concerns and regulatory shifts favoring unions under the Biden administration.
